message.content:
I'm really sorry you're feeling this way. It's normal to want to be understood, and many people go through times when they feel isolated or misunderstood. Talking to others can often help—sometimes just expressing your feelings out loud can make things feel lighter, and it might help others understand you better too. If you feel comfortable, you could try reaching out to a friend, family member, or someone you trust. If it's hard to start, even sharing a small part of how you're feeling can be a good first step.

If these feelings persist or become overwhelming, it might also help to talk to a mental health professional. You're not alone, and there are people who care and want to listen.

conversation_history.text: Sometimes I feel like no one understands me. Should I talk to others more?

I'm really sorry you're feeling this way. It's normal to want to be understood, and many people go through times when they feel isolated or misunderstood. Talking to others can often help—sometimes just expressing your feelings out loud can make things feel lighter, and it might help others understand you better too. If you feel comfortable, you could try reaching out to a friend, family member, or someone you trust. If it's hard to start, even sharing a small part of how you're feeling can be a good first step.

If these feelings persist or become overwhelming, it might also help to talk to a mental health professional. You're not alone, and there are people who care and want to listen.
